entry.title: CARESCORE Newsletter #1
entry.content:
CARESCORE Newsletter #1 - February 11, 2025

Welcome!

I’m starting this newsletter to share interesting resources regarding the project. Let me know if you’d like me to add someone else to this list!

🚀 Upcoming Event

EUHPP Webinar on European Health Data Space (2/3): Secondary Use of Health Data
📅 Date: February 27, 2025
🕒 Time: 15:30 - 17:00 (CET)
🔗 Register here: health.ec.europa.eu

🌍 Ongoing Projects Worldwide

🇫🇮 Finland: FinOMOP Swarm Learning Pilot

  • Exploring Swarm Learning and Blockchain for OMOP.
  • 🔗 Ohdsi Showcase
  • 🔗 LinkedIn Post

🇮🇪 Ireland & Northern Ireland: eHealth-Hub for Cancer

  • Advancing cancer research through eHealth technologies.
  • 🔗 eHealth4Cancer

🇳🇱 Netherlands: Dementia Research Consortium

  • The Netherlands Consortium of Dementia Cohorts (NCDC) is working on dementia-related research.
  • 🔗 Read more

🔬 Partner Projects - Tune Insight

🧒 TI4Pec

  • Federated Learning on OMOP-ized pediatric emergency data across Italy and Switzerland.
  • 🔗 ti4pec.eu

🩺 Phase IV AI

  • Privacy-preserving federated & centralized AI algorithms for oncology and ischemic stroke across Europe.
  • Harmonized under OMOP, including imaging and EHR data.
  • Includes Finnish partners involved in TEHDAS2.
  • 🔗 Phase IV AI

📩 Stay Connected

Best,
Hugo Guillen-Ramirez
Advanced Postdoctoral Researcher
Department of Visceral Surgery and Medicine
Bern University Hospital, University of Bern
📎 LinkedIn

Let me know if you’d like me to add someone else to this list! 🚀 Upcoming Event EUHPP Webinar on European Health Data Space (2/3): Secondary Use of Health Data 📅 Date: February 27, 2025 🕒 Time: 15:30 - 17:00 (CET) 🔗 Register here: health.ec.europa.eu 🌍 Ongoing Projects Worldwide 🇫🇮 Finland: FinOMOP Swarm Learning Pilot Exploring Swarm Learning and Blockchain for OMOP. 🔗 Ohdsi Showcase 🔗 LinkedIn Post 🇮🇪 Ireland & Northern Ireland: eHealth-Hub for Cancer Advancing cancer research through eHealth technologies. 🔗 eHealth4Cancer 🇳🇱 Netherlands: Dementia Research Consortium The Netherlands Consortium of Dementia Cohorts (NCDC) is working on dementia-related research. 🔗 Read more 🔬 Partner Projects - Tune Insight 🧒 TI4Pec Federated Learning on OMOP-ized pediatric emergency data across Italy and Switzerland. 🔗 ti4pec.eu 🩺 Phase IV AI Privacy-preserving federated & centralized AI algorithms for oncology and ischemic stroke across Europe. Harmonized under OMOP, including imaging and EHR data. Includes Finnish partners involved in TEHDAS2. 🔗 Phase IV AI 📩 Stay Connected Best, Hugo Guillen-Ramirez Advanced Postdoctoral Researcher Department of Visceral Surgery and Medicine Bern University Hospital, University of Bern 📎 LinkedIn

entry.title: Transition Year at UCD Conway Institute

link.title: Transition Year at UCD Conway Institute

entry.content:
I had the pleasure of work with Transition Year students at the UCD Conway Institute, talking about my daily work as a scientist and delivering some workshops on coding. Take a look at the tweets by Amgen Biotech:

Thank you to researchers from @sysbioire @UCD_Conway @CharlesUCD who worked with and inspired transition year students this week. @HugoGuillen @tanwi_vartak @LefeivreT @ANwaokorie @TheRealPDogue @serviveforlife 1/2 pic.twitter.com/qiSm0hCTIo

— Amgen Biotech Experience Ireland (@abe_ireland) November 19, 2021

And @DaniGalvinNeuro, Cara Gaffney, @MarziaPendino, Jillian Scully, Ciara Lynch @biOrbic_centre, Elaine Waters, @JadejaShahnawaz and Tina Uroda. Thank you all! pic.twitter.com/Dt1SgrX1XR

— Amgen Biotech Experience Ireland (@abe_ireland) November 19, 2021
entry.summary: I had the pleasure of work with Transition Year students at the UCD Conway Institute, talking about my daily work as a scientist and delivering some workshops on coding. Take a look at the tweets by Amgen Biotech: Thank you to researchers from @sysbioire @UCD_Conway @CharlesUCD who worked with and inspired transition year students this week. @HugoGuillen @tanwi_vartak @LefeivreT @ANwaokorie @TheRealPDogue @serviveforlife 1/2 pic.twitter.com/qiSm0hCTIo— Amgen Biotech Experience Ireland (@abe_ireland) November 19, 2021 And @DaniGalvinNeuro, Cara Gaffney, @MarziaPendino, Jillian Scully, Ciara Lynch @biOrbic_centre, Elaine Waters, @JadejaShahnawaz and Tina Uroda. Thank you all! pic.twitter.com/Dt1SgrX1XR— Amgen Biotech Experience Ireland (@abe_ireland) November 19, 2021

entry.title: Six Marie Skłodowska-Curie fellows are coming to the University of Bern

link.title: Six Marie Skłodowska-Curie fellows are coming to the University of Bern

entry.content:
Media release regarding my Marie Curie fellowship for the University of Bern.

“The University of Bern is welcoming six Marie Skłodowska-Curie fellows this year. The “Marie Skłodowska-Curie Individual Fellowships”, awarded annually by the European Commission, give experienced researchers the opportunity to enrich their scientific careers with a stay abroad.”

Link to the full article.
entry.summary: The University of Bern is welcoming six Marie Skłodowska-Curie fellows this year. The "Marie Skłodowska-Curie Individual Fellowships", awarded annually by the European Commission, give experienced researchers the opportunity to enrich their scientific careers with a stay abroad.
